alert.note: Alert for Greene (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 20 at 6:53PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following counties, Greene, Pickens and Sumter. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 653 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Aliceville, Gordo, Reform, Carrollton, Pickensville, Gainesville, Epes, Ethelsville, Emelle, Memphis, McMullen, Garden, Johnston Lake, New West Greene, West Greene, Panola, Bevill Lock And Dam, Geiger, George Downer Airport and Pleasant Ridge.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
